intro: Psoralea ramulosa, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Psoralea ramulosa is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
